required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Phase III Study Comparing the Efficacy and Safety of EP2006 and Filgrastim
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-blind, Parallel-group, Multi-center Phase III Study Comparing the Efficacy and Safety of EP2006 and Neupogen® in Breast Cancer Patients Treated With Myelosuppressive Chemotherapy

brief_summary.textblock: The study will assess the efficacy of EP2006 compared to Filgrastim with respect to the mean duration of severe neutropenia during treatment with myelosuppressive chemotherapy in breast cancer patients.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Duration of Grade 4 Neutropenia During Cycle 1 of Chemotherapy
primary_outcome.description: Mean duration of severe neutropenia, defined as the mean number of consecutive days with Grade 4 neutropenia (ANC less than 0.5*10^9 cells/L)

secondary_outcome.description: Incidence of febrile neutropenia by duraton within each cycle and across all cycles. Febrile neutropenia is defined as oral temperature greater than or equal 38.3°C while having an Absolute Neutrophil Count < 0.5*10^9 cells/L (both measured on the same day)
Number of days of fever by cycle. Fever is defined as oral temperature greater than or equal to 38.3°C.

secondary_outcome.measure: Depth of Absolute Neutrophil Count Nadir
secondary_outcome.description: Depth of Absolute Neutrophil Count Nadir, defined as the patient's lowest Absolute Neutrophil Count in cycle 1

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Absolute Neutrophil Count Recovery
secondary_outcome.description: Time to Absolute Neutrophil Count recovery, defined as the time in days from Absolute Neutrophil Count nadir until the patient's Absolute Neutrophil Count increases to more or equal to 2*10^9 cells/L after the nadir in cycle 1
Frequency of infections by cycle and across all cycles

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Hospitalizations Due to Febrile Neutropenia
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence of hospitalizations due to Febrile Neutropenia

arm_group.description: Eligible patients will be teated with EP2006
Eligible patients will be teated with Filgrastim

intervention.description: Eligible patients will be teated with EP2006
Eligible patients will be teated with Filgrastim

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Patients with histologically proven breast cancer, eligible for neoadjuvant or adjuvant myelosuppressive chemotherapy
2. Women ≥ 18 years of age
3. Estimated life expectancy of more than six months
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Previous or concurrent malignancy except non-invasive non-melanoma skin cancer, in situ carcinoma of the cervix, or other solid tumor treated curatively, and without evidence of recurrence for at least ten years prior to study entry
2. Any serious illness or medical condition that may interfere with safety, compliance, response to the products under investigation and their evaluation, e.g.:
Other protocol-defined inclusion/exclusion criteria may apply.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: The study population consisted of women of 18 years or older with histologically proven breast cancer who were eligible for neoadjuvant or adjuvant treatment with TAC chemotherapy. The study was aimed to randomize a total of 192 patients in approximately 65 centers worldwide.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: The study started with a screening period of up to 21 days. During the screening period, the eligibility of the patients to participate in the study was assessed based on safety evaluations. After completion of the screening period, the patients were randomized to either EP2006 or US-licensed Neupogen® in four groups (see below).

group.title: EP2006
group.description: Patients remained on EP2006 (their initial treatment) throughout the study daily dose of 5 mcg/kg body weight, subcutaneously

group.title: EP2006 + Neupogen
group.description: Patients received alternating treatment with EP2006 or Neupogen starting with the second cycle, daily dose of 5 mcg/kg body weight, subcutaneously

group.title: Neupogen + EP2006
group.description: Patients received alternating treatment with Neupogen or EP2006 starting with the 2nd cycle, daily dose of 5 mcg/kg body weight, subcutaneously

group.title: Neupogen
group.description: Patients remained on Neupogen (their initial treatment) throughout the study, daily dose of 5 mcg/kg body weight, subcutaneously

baseline.population: The safety set consists of all patients who received at least one dose of study drug and had at least one post-baseline safety assessment

group.description: Patients remained on EP2006 (their initial treatment) throughout the study

group.description: Patients remained on Neupogen (their initial treatment) throughout the study

group.description: Total of all reporting groups

group.description: All subjects randomized to receive either EP2006 in Cycle 1

measure.title: Mean Duration of Grade 4 Neutropenia During Cycle 1 of Chemotherapy

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Non-inferiority limit: -1 day Power: 90% Confidence level: 97.5% Randomization ratio: 1:1 (EP2006:Neupogen)

outcome.title: Incidence of Febrile Neutropenia
outcome.description: Incidence of febrile neutropenia by duraton within each cycle and across all cycles. Febrile neutropenia is defined as oral temperature greater than or equal 38.3°C while having an Absolute Neutrophil Count < 0.5*10^9 cells/L (both measured on the same day)
outcome.population: SAF-I (alternating safety) set: patients who received at least one dose of study medication after Cycle 1.

group.description: Patients remained on EP2006 (their initial treatment) throughout the study

group.title: EP2006 + Neupogen
group.description: Patients received alternating treatment with EP2006 or Neupogen starting with the second cycle

group.title: Neupogen + EP2006
group.description: Patients received alternating treatment with Neupogen or EP2006 starting with the 2nd cycle

group.title: Neupogen
group.description: Patients remained on Neupogen (their initial treatment) throughout the study

group.title: Total
group.description: All patients

measure.title: Incidence of Febrile Neutropenia
measure.description: Incidence of febrile neutropenia by duraton within each cycle and across all cycles. Febrile neutropenia is defined as oral temperature greater than or equal 38.3°C while having an Absolute Neutrophil Count < 0.5*10^9 cells/L (both measured on the same day)
measure.population: SAF-I (alternating safety) set: patients who received at least one dose of study medication after Cycle 1.

outcome.title: Number of Days of Fever
outcome.description: Number of days of fever by cycle. Fever is defined as oral temperature greater than or equal to 38.3°C.
outcome.population: PP-I (alternating Per-Protocol) set: randomized patients who completed all six chemotherapy cycles without major protocol violations.

outcome.title: Depth of Absolute Neutrophil Count Nadir
outcome.description: Depth of Absolute Neutrophil Count Nadir, defined as the patient's lowest Absolute Neutrophil Count in cycle 1
outcome.population: FAS (full analysis) set: all patients who received at least one dose of study medication, analyzed according to randomization allocation

group.title: EP2006 + EP2006 & Neupogen
group.description: All subjects randomized to receive either EP2006 in Cycle 1

group.title: Neupogen + Neupogen & EP2006
group.description: All subjects randomized to receive Neupogen in Cycle 1

group.title: Total
group.description: All patients in Cycle 1

measure.title: Depth of Absolute Neutrophil Count Nadir
measure.description: Depth of Absolute Neutrophil Count Nadir, defined as the patient's lowest Absolute Neutrophil Count in cycle 1
measure.population: FAS (full analysis) set: all patients who received at least one dose of study medication, analyzed according to randomization allocation

outcome.title: Time to Absolute Neutrophil Count Recovery
outcome.description: Time to Absolute Neutrophil Count recovery, defined as the time in days from Absolute Neutrophil Count nadir until the patient's Absolute Neutrophil Count increases to more or equal to 2*10^9 cells/L after the nadir in cycle 1
outcome.population: FAS (full analysis) set: all patients who received at least one dose of study medication, analyzed according to randomization allocation. In the EP2006 + EP2006 & Neupogen group, one patient’s time to Absolute Neutrophil Count recovery could not be measured as the nadir was the last measured timepoint.

group.title: EP2006 + EP2006 & Neupogen
group.description: All subjects randomized to receive either EP2006 in Cycle 1

group.title: Neupogen + Neupogen & EP2006
group.description: All subjects randomized to receive Neupogen in Cycle 1

group.title: Total
group.description: All patients in Cycle 1

measure.title: Time to Absolute Neutrophil Count Recovery
measure.description: Time to Absolute Neutrophil Count recovery, defined as the time in days from Absolute Neutrophil Count nadir until the patient's Absolute Neutrophil Count increases to more or equal to 2*10^9 cells/L after the nadir in cycle 1
measure.population: FAS (full analysis) set: all patients who received at least one dose of study medication, analyzed according to randomization allocation. In the EP2006 + EP2006 & Neupogen group, one patient’s time to Absolute Neutrophil Count recovery could not be measured as the nadir was the last measured timepoint.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: PI shall provide Sponsor with any presentation at least 15 working days prior to disclosure and any other publication at least 45 working days prior to disclosure. Sponsor may require amendments on reasonable grounds: (a) accuracy of publication; (b) confidentiality of proprietary information; (c) intellectual property protection; (d) to enable further information to be provided. Sponsor may require publications or presentations to be delayed up to four (4) months to enable patent application.
